title: Federal Hill (Fredericksburg, Virginia)
text:
Federal Hill is a historic home located at <a href="Fredericksburg%2C%20Virginia">Fredericksburg, Virginia</a>. It was built about 1794, and is a -story, brick and frame dwelling sheathed in weatherboard, with a two-story frame wing. It has a gable roof with dormers. The front facade has a central pedimented pavilion and recessed fanlight door. The large ballroom and elaborate dining room are distinctive for their mixing of late colonial and <a href="Federal%20architecture">Federal</a> detailing. Federal Hill was probably built by <a href="Robert%20Brooke%20%28Virginia%20governor%29">Robert Brooke</a> (1761–1800), governor of Virginia from 1794 to 1796.
It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1975.
